h1.a: Important Message from the Superintendent, Dr. Miguel Hernandez, RE School Closure

section.p: Please click on the link to read/download the message.

h1.a: A Message From MRHS Board President - Ellen Fischer
A Message from Superintendent of Schools - Dr. Miguel Hernandez

section.p: Please click on the link to download the budget.

Parents and guardians in need of child care can contact the Child Care Resource and Referral Agency in their county. CCR&Rs will have the most up to date information on available care options and subsidies. Go to: www.nj.gov/dcf/coronavirus.

div.div: Dear Parents, Students, Staff and Community Members,

On behalf of the MRHS Board of Education, I would like to welcome you to the 2019-2020 school year. We are excited about the school year and look forward to the experience of educating your child in a caring environment. Our goal is to provide an educational experience that offers an opportunity for students to grow both intellectually and as individuals. We are fortunate to have dedicated teachers and staff who focus on meeting the needs of all students. MRHS is committed to forming a partnership with parents and families to maximize student achievement. I feel very fortunate to be the superintendent of such a dedicated learning community.

The district is in its second year of the 1:1 device initiative in which every student and staff member will have access to a Google Chromebook. Under the direction of school principal, Mr. Coviello, all incoming ninth graders and returning students will receive their Chromebook during the second week of school. It is our hope, and district goal, to increase the availability of technology for our students and staff.

During the summer the MRHS Library was renovated and renamed the Innovation Center. This was a huge undertaking to say the least. Now it is a 21st Century room, equipped with modern technology, makerspace, many charging stations and modern furniture. This room will be the main hub of the building where students gather to research, study and complete homework.

I thank you for your continued support of the school district. For more information concerning all MRHS activities and programs, please check the district website at www.mrhs.net or visit our social media pages at www.twitter.com/ManchesterRHS and www.facebook.com/ManchesterHS

The 2019-2020 school year has arrived! A year that will usher in new opportunities for learning, growth, and making new friends for your child. We are so excited that our 1:1 Chromebook Initiative will be continuing this year as we continue to enhance our technology access for students. Also, our new Innovation Center will be open full time for the student body and will offer library/media services, research databases, new and high interest books, and a state of the art maker space where students can engage in creative activities such as 3D printing. Furthermore, all science classrooms have been renovated as of this September. Moreover, our new drone elective will teach students how to build, repair, and pilot cutting edge technology as well as use it to become adept at aerial videography and the opportunity to earn their FAA drone pilot's license. These are just some of the wonderful improvements we have to offer for the 2019-2020 school year and we have just begun our exciting work here at MRHS!

With that said, I urge you to keep participating in your child's education in any way that you can. Partner with us to enjoy our wide array of co-curricular activities and support your child her/his academic endeavors. It is the people that give life to a school experience. Working together I know we will continue to offer your child the best experience possible!
“The secret of education is respecting the pupil.” –Ralph Waldo Emerson
